abstract: Karen Rosenberg reviews exhibit of participatory installations by artist Carsten Holler at the New Museum of Contemporary Art.
snippet: “Carsten Höller: Experience,” hailed as an art world amusement park, includes a 102-foot slide and an installation of flashing lights that is supposed to make you hallucinate.
lead_paragraph: “Carsten Höller: Experience,” hailed as an art world amusement park, includes a 102-foot slide and an installation of flashing lights that is supposed to make you hallucinate.

headline.main: Where Visitors Take the Plunge, or Plunges
headline.print_headline: Where Visitors Take the Plunge, or Plunges
headline.seo: ‘Carsten Höller: Experience’ at the New Museum - Review
